alert.note: Alert for Northern Hancock; Pearl River; Southern Hancock (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 2:41PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Hancock and south central Pearl River Counties through 315 PM CDT... At 241 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm producing funnel clouds 8 miles east of Picayune, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Tropical funnel clouds and winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...If a funnel cloud briefly touches down, minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Bay St. Louis, Diamondhead and Kiln. This includes Interstate 10 in Mississippi between mile markers 13 and 18. FUNNEL CLOUDS...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief tropical funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors or to safe harbor and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Northern Hancock; Pearl River; Southern Hancock
